    • GameSceneController

      public GameSceneController()

  • Method Details

    • itemClick

      public void itemClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method check if the clicked item can be drawn only if it's the players turn.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is the event handler need to get the fxid of the item clicked.

    • putClick

      public void putClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method checks if the item in the drawPile can be placed in the bookshelf by sending a request to the server. The request is sent if the input is reasonable => drawPile not empty and a column in the bookshelf have been selected.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - si not used.

    • drawClick

      public void drawClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method start the draw process for the player if it's the players turn.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is not used.

    • drawPileClick

      public void drawPileClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method saves the selected item in the draPile if the draw process is in progress.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is not used.

    • UpClicked

      public void UpClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method moves the selected item in the drawPile by one position (upward).
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is not used.

    • DownClicked

      public void DownClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method moves the selected item in the drawPile by one position (downward).
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is not used.

    • pickCol

      public void pickCol(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method saves the selected column of the bookshelf.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is needed to get the unique fxid of the button clicked. Each fxid has a corresponding column assigned.

    • setScene

      public void setScene()
      This method is used to set the main scene of the game. the method initialize all the data structure that the javafx scene use as reference to show the correct Image on screen. For example : DrawPile is initialized with the fx-ids of the corresponding ImageView on the scene.

    • chatEnter

      public void chatEnter(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method sends the message saved in the GUI to the server. If the message is private a receiver must be selected before invoking the method, otherwise the method notifies the player that the receiver haven't been selected.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is not used.

    • privateChatEnter

      public void privateChatEnter(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method start the private message process. Once clicked the player must send a private message to turn back at sending public messages.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is not used.

    • inputKey

      public void inputKey(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      This method saves the chat input from the player in the GUI.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - is not used.

    • privateReceiverClicked

      public void privateReceiverClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method saves the receiver for a private message in the GUI. The method works only if the private message process has started.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is needed to get the fx-id of the selected TextField corresponding to a player username.
